sen.j: 道長が大堰川に漢詩の舟、管絃の舟、和歌の舟を出し、それぞれの分野の名人を乗せた際、乗る舟を尋ねられた公任は和歌の舟を選び、「小倉山嵐の風の寒ければもみぢの錦きぬ人ぞなき」と詠んで賞賛された。
sen.e: One time at the Oigawa river when Michinaga had set up boats of Chinese Poetry, Music, and Waka Poetry, with the masters of each field aboard, and Kinto was asked which boat he would ride, he chose the boat of waka poetry and was praised for his composition, "As the wind blowing down the Mt. Arashiyama is cold, there's no one who won't wear a fine dress of colored leaves."

Arashiyama is cold, there is no one who won't wear the fine dress of colored leaves."

Arashiyama is cold, there is no one who won't wear the fine dress of colored leaves."

sen.j: ところが公任は、漢詩の舟を選んでおけば、もっと名声が上がったはずだと悔やみ、道長に舟を選べと言われたときに、すべての分野で認められているとうぬぼれてしまったと述懐した。
sen.e: However, Kinto was regretful, thinking that if he chosen the boat of Chinese poetry, he would have won even more renown, reminiscing that when Michinaga told him to choose a boat, he was full of pride at being thought a master of all three fields.

sen.j: この時代、強盗・窃盗・私鋳銭の3つの罪については検非違使が裁判を行うことになっていたが、長徳2年（996年）11月に検非違使の最高責任者であった検非違使庁別当である公任の別当宣によって、初めて着鈦勘文（判決文）に徒罪（懲役）年数が書かれることになった。
sen.e: In those days, the imperial police (kebiishi) conducted trials for the following three crimes: robbery, theft and private minting, and in November 996, in a police edict by Kinto, then head of the imperial police, it was ordered for the first time that the length of penal servitude (zukei) be clearly written in judgment documents (chakuda kanmon).
sen.cmt: 徒罪 ずざい＝徒刑（ずけい、とけい）（デジタル大辞泉）半年ごとに5等級ということなので、「年数」→期間とした。原文「検非違使の最高責任者であった検非違使庁別当である」→同じことの繰り返しなので、翻訳では一度にした。検非違使庁別当 http://books.google.com/books?id=KCZ2ya6cg88C&pg=PA96&dq=bettosen+police&lr=&as_brr=3&hl=ja別当宣(参考） http://books.google.com/books?id=wdMgLJXMhx8C&pg=PA213&dq=police+edict+kebiishi&as_brr=3&hl=jahttp://books.google.com/books?id=KCZ2ya6cg88C&pg=PA96&dq=bettosen+police&lr=&as_brr=3&hl=ja
sen.e: In those days, the Imperial Police (kebiishi) conducted trials for the following three crimes: robbery, theft and private minting, and in November 996, in a police edict by Kinto, then head of the Imperial Police, it was ordered for the first time that the length of penal servitude (zukei) be clearly written in judgment documents (chakuda kanmon).

sen.cmt: kanmon→kammon ヘボン式に修正しました。

sen.j: それまでは、被害額の総額に応じて徒の年数は定められていたものの、その年数が罪人に示されることは無く、罪人は釈放されて初めて自分がどんな刑罰を受けたのかを知ったという。
sen.e: Before this, though the length of penal servitude was decided in proportion to the sum of the lost money, the actual term of imprisonment was never told to the criminals and it is said that they never knew what kind of punishment they had been sentenced to until they were released.

sen.j: この時、左衛門志であった明法家（法律家）の惟宗允亮は、公任の意向に沿って素晴らしい着鈦勘文を書き上げ、法律家としての名声を高めたという。
sen.e: It is said that the legal scholar Koremune no Tadasuke, who was serving as Left Gate Guards Clerk at that time, wrote excellent Chakuda Kanmon following Kinto's intention and gained in reputation as a jurist.
